wsintelliauction.lib.net
Class Recipient

java.lang.Object
  wsintelliauction.lib.net.Recipient

public class Recipient
extends java.lang.Object

Represents a recipient of messages in the network communication link, i.e. the destination for a message sent from the initialiser of this object, which is the source for all messages sent. If the initialiser sends a message, this recipient object defines the destination for that message, where the host is the source.

Author:
James Lewis
See Also:
InetAddress

Constructor Detail

Recipient

public Recipient(java.lang.String hostAddress,
                 int portNumber)
          throws java.net.UnknownHostException
Constructs a new recipient given the host address and port number. Host address can be either the host name (i.e. "nightmare.cs.uct.ac.za") or textual representation of an IP address (i.e. "137.158.59.46").

Parameters:
hostAddress - Host name or IP address.
portNumber - Port number.
Throws:
java.net.UnknownHostException - If unable to locate the host.

Recipient

public Recipient(byte[] ipAddress,
                 int portNumber)
          throws java.net.UnknownHostException
Constructs a new recipient given the host IP address and port number. Host IP address must be a raw address as an array of bytes (signed).

Parameters:
hostAddress - Raw IP address.
portNumber - Port number.
Throws:
java.net.UnknownHostException - If unable to locate the host.
